author: Phil Roberts

description: This book offers strategies for enhancing service quality and increasing profitability in the hospitality industry, focusing on building repeat business, improving guest loyalty, and effective marketing programs.

author: Entrepreneur Press
description: This comprehensive guide provides aspiring entrepreneurs with the knowledge and tools needed to start and run a successful bar or club. It covers various types of establishments, including sports bars, nightclubs, neighborhood bars, and wine bars, offering insights into market research, location selection, licensing, layout design, equipment procurement, inventory management, operations, staffing, entertainment, marketing, and financial management.

Christine France
Maggie Mayhew

Covering a wide array of accompaniments—from classic sauces to spiced mustards—the book provides step-by-step instructions accompanied by 1,400 photographs, making it accessible for both novice and experienced cooks.

title: Learn and Practice Hotel Housekeeping
author: Celia E. Cariño
Jennefer L. Yap
description: This book provides a comprehensive guide to hotel housekeeping, covering topics such as housekeeping profiles, areas, standards, principles of cleaning, types of cleaning, hotel amenities, cleaning tools and equipment, cleaning procedures by area, other housekeeping tasks, and laundry operation.

title: Key Concepts in Event Management
author: Bernadette Quinn
description: This book provides a comprehensive overview of essential concepts in event management, offering students and professionals insights into the theoretical frameworks and practical applications within the event and festival industry.

title: Risk Management with HACCP
author: Mylene A. Yeung
description: This book provides an in-depth guide to risk management strategies using the HACCP (Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point) system, essential for ensuring food safety and quality in hospitality and food service industries.

title: Purchasing and Costing for the Hospitality Industry (Book with DVD)

title: Thermal Processing of Foods: Control and Automation
author: K. P. Sandeep
description: This book explores the application of automated control systems in the thermal processing of foods, discussing the evolution and validation of sophisticated software-driven, on-line control systems in the food industry.

author: R.K. Arora
description: This book provides comprehensive insights into the structure and management of hotel organizations, with a particular focus on front office operations. title: Korean Grammar: The Complete Guide to Speaking Korean Naturally
author: Soohee Kim
Emily Curtis

It is designed for students taking a Korean language course, self-study learners, and heritage learners who wish to communicate more effectively in Korean.

title: Introduction to Food Microbiology
author: Kamal Duggal
description: This book provides an in-depth exploration of food microbiology, covering topics such as the role of microorganisms in food production, spoilage, and safety. It delves into the principles of fermentation, preservation techniques, and the impact of microbes on food quality and human health.

title: Techniques of Healthy Cooking
author: The Culinary Institute of America (CIA)
description: This comprehensive kitchen reference from The Culinary Institute of America provides an in-depth understanding of nutrition concepts, healthy eating patterns, recipe development, and cooking techniques. It features nearly 500 recipes, including soups, salads, appetizers, and main dishes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, along with over 150 full-color photographs of ingredients, techniques, and finished dishes.

title: Umami Recipes: Discover the Fifth Taste
author: Ajinomoto Group
description: This collection showcases a variety of recipes that highlight umami, the fifth basic taste. Curated by the Ajinomoto Group, the book offers dishes from around the world, emphasizing the use of umami-rich ingredients to enhance flavor.

title: The Complete Guide to Successful Event Planning
author: Shannon Kilkenny
description: This comprehensive guide offers practical advice and strategies for planning a wide range of events, from casual gatherings to black-tie galas. It covers essential topics such as budgeting, venue selection, catering, entertainment, and logistics, providing event planners with the tools needed to execute successful events.

title: 100 Classic Napkin Folds: Simple and Stylish Napkins for Every Occasion
author: Rick Beech
description: This comprehensive guide offers 100 napkin folding designs suitable for various table settings and occasions. Each fold is presented with step-by-step instructions and over 700 photographs, ranging from simple designs to more intricate creations, enabling readers to enhance their dining presentations.
